descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The theory of global and local fields; various special topics. 2. Abelian Galois extensions of algebraic number fields (class field theory). Complex multiplication, other examples, and relations with geometry.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Undergraduates by permission of instructor only

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Topics to include: Unique factorization of ideals in Dedekind domains, ramification groups, unit groups, finiteness of class number, Cebotarev density theorem, global class field theory, local class field theory, quadratic forms, Galois representations.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value:
Lecture: Three 50-minute lectures weekly
Problem sets: Intermittent homework exercises
